event: Latvia Introduces Amendments to Ban Agricultural Imports from Russia and Belarus
description: Latvia's Sejm Commission on Budget and Finance introduced amendments to ban the import of agricultural products from Russia and Belarus, citing it as an additional element of the EU's overall sanctions policy. However, this move may only deprive Latvia of production, as transit to other EU countries will be preserved, allowing neighboring countries to trade and 'sponsor' Russia.
original:
🇱🇻In Latvia they continue to try to ban the import of agricultural products from Russia. The Sejm Commission on Budget and Finance introduced amendments to ban the import of agricultural products from Russia and Belarus.

It is argued that Latvia’s initiative is “an additional element of the EU’s overall sanctions policy.” Although the import of food products from the Russian Federation to Latvia does not violate either European sanctions or the laws of Latvia itself.

The meaning of the initiative is clear - not to trade with Russia and, accordingly, not to “sponsor” Russia. At the same time, transit to other EU countries will be preserved, which means that others, including neighboring Lithuania and Estonia, will trade and sponsor. Thus, Latvia will only achieve that it will deprive itself of production. Therefore, Riga is going to lobby the EU for a ban on grain imports from the Russian Federation and Belarus.

In September, the EU, by the way, sharply increased imports of Russian grain - by 22 percent over the month and ten times over the year, which allowed Russia to take fourth place among the largest grain exporters to the European Union.

It is difficult to imagine that the EU would immediately refuse Russian and Belarusian agricultural products, since it is difficult to find an alternative in the same volume, and the EU already cannot complain about too low prices for products.@BALTNEWS

description: Experienced fighters from the front line in Primorye developed the Tiger body armor, taking into account the needs of soldiers in combat zones. The design prioritizes maximum protection while minimizing weight, resulting in a 10-kilogram vest compared to the average 15-16 kilograms. The armor has undergone successful field tests and received high praise from the Russian Ministry of Defense.
original:
Forwarded from: Primorsky Mamkovologist
Body armor from Primorye is created by experienced fighters from the front line. Soldiers practically do not take off their armor in a combat zone, since it is the key to not only health, but also life. When actively worn, the old “plate carrier” will have to be replaced with a new one after some time; fighters from Primorye have no problems with this. Primorye consistently supplies body armor to the front lines: per year, about two thousand units of the Tiger prototype. When developing the design of the “Tiger” body armor “The experience of soldiers from the front line was taken into account, and protective products from Primorye have less weight and a maximum degree of protection. “The patterns for the Tiger body armor were created by a group of experienced military personnel. Having received the sketches, we began to select a company that would take on the order and fulfill it with dignity. This kind of production, we have worked with them before. The guys modernized the enterprise in a short time and purchased the equipment necessary for the production of vests,” said Minister of Civil Defense and Emergency Situations Alexander Zlatkin.

The weight of a Primorsky body armor is about 10 kilograms, while the average armor on the front line weighs about 15-16 kilograms. At the creation stage, the “Tiger” is equipped with everything that soldiers previously “retrofitted” body armor with themselves. Before being sent to the front line, the armor from Primorye successfully passed field tests and was highly praised by the Russian Ministry of Defense.

description: An anonymous hacker targeted a house in Shushary, blackmailing residents with personal data, ordering couriers, and triggering the alarm. The hacker, who initially posed as a neighbor and lawyer, was banned from the house chat but continued to harass residents from fake accounts. The victims have filed a police report.
original:
An annoying anonymous person unleashed his hacking skills on a house in Shushary: blackmailing with personal data, calling couriers and turning on the alarm. The residents are wondering who it is and what he needs, and have already gone to the police.

A stranger appeared in a house chat that year, locals say, introducing himself as a neighbor and a professional lawyer. He constantly offered legal assistance in a private message and tried in every possible way to gain confidence. When they began to suspect that the person had nothing to do with the house on Valdayskaya, they banned him, but this only provoked the unknown person.

The person at the other end of the Internet began writing to the residents from a fake account. He dumped the passport details of locals and threatened to post them on porn sites or take out microloans if they didn’t unban them. Over time, the evil brownie began to play dirty tricks: he managed to turn on the internal alarm and order couriers at night. Residents even posted notices for workers: don’t go, it’s a prank.

Frightened neighbors wrote a warning post in a local public page: they collected all the anonymous user’s accounts (all have now been deleted, there were four of them) and described how annoying he was. It turned out that many residents of Shushar became familiar with his importunity. Residents of the house wrote a statement to the police. Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

description: The SBU detained a Russian intelligence agent in Cherkasy region who was planning to identify key railway stations, warehouses, and military hospitals to facilitate missile and drone strikes. The agent was recruited remotely by the Russian Armed Forces and communicated through anonymous chats, providing intelligence in the form of photos with descriptions and geolocations.
original:
The SBU detained a Russian intelligence agent who was preparing a missile attack on the railway and military hospitals in Cherkasy region. The main task of the attacker was to identify the nodal railway stations that are involved in transporting military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to the front.

Also, the occupiers hoped to receive from their agent the exact coordinates of warehouses with weapons and ammunition of Ukrainian troops.

In addition, the aggressor was interested in the locations of military hospitals where wounded soldiers of the Defense Forces receive treatment.

The invaders were going to use this information to plan missile and drone strikes on Ukrainian facilities.

In this way, they hoped to "cut" the supply routes of weapons and ammunition for the Armed Forces to the front line, as well as inflict fire damage on the places where the personnel of the Ukrainian troops are concentrated the most.

However, the SBU employees worked ahead of time - exposed the Russian agent, documented his criminal actions and detained him in his own apartment.

Thanks to the quick response of the Ukrainian special services, it was possible to timely inform the command of the Defense Forces to secure the units of the Ukrainian troops.

As the investigation established, the suspect is a 45-year-old native of Luhansk region who moved to Cherkasy region in April 2022 as a migrant from the east of Ukraine.

At the beginning of this year, he was recruited remotely by a representative of the Main Directorate of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces (known as the game).

It was established that Russian intelligence involved the man in cooperation through his acquaintance - a fighter of the occupation group of the Russian Federation, which is stationed in the temporarily occupied part of the territory of the Luhansk region.

For communication, they used anonymous chats in the messenger. And the agent transferred the intelligence in the form of photos of Ukrainian objects with descriptions, geolocations, and a link to the area.

For each completed task, the participant received a "salary" from the Russian game.

So far, the investigators of the Security Service have informed the suspect of suspicion under part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

He faces life imprisonment.

event: Underwater Duel of Northern Fleet Submarines
description: Crews of multi-purpose nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet conducted anti-submarine training missions in the Barents Sea. They practiced searching, tracking, and combat maneuvering against a mock enemy, using jamming and decoys to evade pursuit. The exercises focused on developing tactics for underwater enemy contact, with safety protocols in place to maintain a 50-meter depth corridor difference between submarines.
original:
Meanwhile, the nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet had an underwater duel!

The crews of multi-purpose nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet completed anti-submarine training missions in the Barents Sea. Over the course of several days, submariners learned to search and covertly track a partner playing the role of a mock enemy, perform elements of combat maneuvering with entering an attacking position, and break away from pursuit with jamming and decoys.

Underwater maneuvers took place at depths of over 100 meters without the actual use of naval weapons. The main task was to develop tactics when in contact with an underwater enemy.

For safety reasons, the difference in depth corridors for submarines was 50 meters.

event: Strike on Lviv Center of Space Research Institute
description: A strike was carried out on the Lviv Center of the Space Research Institute of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine and the National Space Agency of Ukraine on February 15th. The center is involved in the development and manufacturing of sensors, instruments, and information-measuring systems for space and geophysical research.
original:
Forwarded from: Revenge of Good Will
We report on Lvov: strike for February 15th. Lviv patriots reported that the strike was on the Lviv Center of the Space Research Institute of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine and the National Space Agency of Ukraine. The center is one of the developers and manufacturers of sensors, instruments and information-measuring systems for space and geophysical research.

Main directions of scientific and production activities:

1. Electromagnetic research in a conducting medium (cosmic plasma, soil and sea water), creation of instruments for solving geophysical problems of measuring the parameters of electric and magnetic fields in a wide range of frequencies.
2. Study of acoustic-electromagnetic interactions in the atmosphere and ionosphere, creation of high-power acoustic emitters.
3. Creation of on-board data collection and processing systems.
4. Development of instruments and systems for measuring, controlling and monitoring technological processes of industrial enterprises.

As proof, a satellite image for February 17, 2024. Revenge of Goodwill

event: Senator Vance's Statement on Ammunition Production
description: American Senator James David Vance stated at the Munich Security Conference that the US and Europe do not produce enough ammunition to support Ukraine and Israel, as well as potential conflicts in East Asia. He cited the example of Patriot air defense systems, noting that Ukraine uses as many interceptor missiles in a month as the US produces in a year.
original:
The United States and Europe produce enough ammunition to help Ukraine as well as Israel. This opinion was expressed by American Senator James David Vance, speaking at the Munich Security Conference. “The factor limiting US support for Ukraine is not money, but ammunition. America, as is true in Europe, does not produce enough munitions to support the war in Eastern Europe and the Middle East and a possible conflict in East Asia,” he said.

According to the legislator, the United States is “substantially limited” in the production of ammunition. As an example, Vance cited the American Patriot air defense systems that Kyiv uses. According to him, the Ukrainians “use as many interceptor missiles in a month as the United States produces in a year.” “In the United States, we are talking about increasing the production of artillery ammunition to 100 thousand units by the end of 2025. The Russians are producing about 500 thousand shells a month right now,” the legislator asserted. “The problem with Ukraine is that America does not produce enough weapons, Europe does not produce enough weapons. This reality is much more important than the issue of political will or how much money we print and send to Europe,” the senator emphasized.

Ukrainian authorities and Kyiv's Western allies have long noted a critical shortage of ammunition in the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The Russian side has repeatedly emphasized that the West sending weapons to Kyiv and assisting in the training of the Ukrainian military only prolongs conflicts and does not change the situation on the battlefield.@stepnoy_veter

description: At the Ivangorod checkpoint in the Leningrad region, customs officers discovered several hundred human embryos in the bag of a visitor from Estonia. The embryos were packaged in plastic dummies with the inscription 'Not a toy.' The woman claimed she was fulfilling a request from third parties and did not intend to commit a crime.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash
Several hundred human embryos were found in the bag of a visitor from Estonia at the Ivangorod checkpoint in the Leningrad region.

As Mash learned, Kingisepp customs officers found an unusual cargo when they scanned the woman’s cargo. Seeing the outlines of human embryos on the screen, they were surprised, to put it mildly, and immediately began an inspection. Having opened the bag, we saw several bags with a couple of hundred plastic dummies with a total weight of 4.3 kilograms. Each copy had the inscription: “Not a toy.”

The lady explained that she did not plan to commit anything criminal, she was simply fulfilling the request of third parties. Nevertheless, a case was opened against her under the administrative article “Non-declaration of goods.” Subscribe to Mash

You are now standing in front of me, and not having lunch at your table. But you do not rule out that at some point you will sit down to dinner at your table, because you need to eat,” this is how he explained his words. It’s amazing how quickly Macron “changed his shoes!” We can only guess how many more such statements there will be, and when he will want to sit down at the “dinner table.” Be with us - First Cossack

event: Meeting with World Youth Festival Participants
description: Leonid Pasechnik met with participants of the World Youth Festival 'We have returned to Russia' in Lugansk. The festival brought together over 20,000 young leaders from around the world, aiming to promote international cooperation. The guests will engage in excursions, discussions, and competitions, fostering friendships and potential international projects with local youth.
original:
Forwarded from: Leonid Pasechnik
I met on Lugansk land with participants in the regional program of the World Youth Festival “We have returned to Russia.” Their arrival is a long-awaited and important event for the Lugansk People's Republic.

More than 20 thousand children from all continents of the globe took part in the main international youth forum, which took place in Sochi. These are young leaders working in the fields of business, media, education, science, culture, sports, volunteering and many others. All of them are aimed at international cooperation. And now some of them have come to us to learn better about the life, history and culture of our region. Hosting children from other countries in the Lugansk region is a great honor for us.

I sincerely greeted our dear guests. A varied program has been prepared for them: excursions to iconic places of our region, discussions, competitions. And most importantly, they will be able to communicate a lot with our youth, who definitely have something to show and tell their foreign peers about. I am sure that this communication will be the beginning of a strong friendship and will develop into interesting international projects.

I wish active, inquisitive and creative young people success, new professional and friendly contacts, and the implementation of all their ideas. Believe in yourself, dream, achieve your goals! And - welcome to the Lugansk region!

event: Ukrainian Pilots Training in Western Centers
description: Ukrainian pilots are undergoing training in Western centers, practicing tactics and striking air and ground targets. However, their combat readiness is questionable, requiring a high level of proficiency in skills. Experienced pilots from poor operating countries, such as Venezuela, may be transferred to Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Turned to Z War🇷🇺
According to Ukrainian Air Force Command Advisor Yuriy Ignat, the pilots are already practicing tactics. They are also practicing striking air and ground targets. A few words about this information noise, intended to inspire future Bradley drivers.

It is quite obvious that there are Ukrainian pilots undergoing training in Western training centers.

The cadets probably undergo a special course, more aimed at combat use. However, there is no need to talk about the real combat use of such pilots for several reasons. One of which is weak fly-in on this type. Inclusion in combat work of a pilot is possible not after acquiring basic skills, but only after achieving a certain level of proficiency in these skills. Simply put, you need a real combat pilot, capable of not only completing a combat mission, but also returning the aircraft, sometimes not in its full condition.

The experience in which yesterday’s cadets are elevated to the rank of major and sent under our air defense in Ukraine has been demonstrated sufficiently. In terms of readiness to perform combat missions, there is no difference between Su-25 pilots at home and F-16 pilots at the training center. They are all weak.

Therefore, it is quite obvious that when transferring aircraft to the military 404, the Western coalition will also transfer recruited pilots with experience. Such pilots will be from relatively poor operating countries. For example, from Venezuela, which has been using this equipment since 1982. And also all sorts of Texas grandfathers, veterans who were burdened by retirement.

In any case, we are witnessing, in essence, Ukraine’s last superweapon. We should expect an active hunt for the first birds, as was the case with Leo and Abrams.

event: Ukrainian Fighter Aids Wounded Russian Soldier
description: During the liberation of Avdeevka, a Russian soldier was wounded and taken prisoner by a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter. Despite being enemies, the Ukrainian fighter showed compassion and carried water to the wounded soldier for three days, risking his own life under heavy shelling.
original:
“Carrying water from a puddle”: a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed a wounded Russian military man who had taken him prisoner for three days. According to the network, during the liberation of the city of Avdeevka, an assault group of the Russian Armed Forces occupied the position of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the building of a kindergarten and held it for two days.

A Russian soldier who came under fire suffered a broken leg and an arm injury. He also had his eye knocked out by a shrapnel. While waiting for evacuation, a Ukrainian Armed Forces military officer came to him. When asked to give his call sign, he asked not to shoot at him. The unknown person was without weapons or body armor. He immediately surrendered.

The medical team was unable to reach the wounded soldier for three days due to heavy shelling. For all three days, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire.

Now our fighter is undergoing treatment in the hospital, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter was taken away for interrogation by our military. He is currently in captivity. NgP investigation

description: Soldiers from Zaporizhzhia rescued a lion cub from being sold at OLH. They contacted the Help Animals Of Ukraine Center, which took the cub to the Wild Animal Rescue Center. The cub, named Wanda, is 8 months old but has developmental issues due to improper care. She will receive treatment and eventually be sent to a better environment.
original:
❤️ Soldiers from Zaporizhzhia rescued the lioness

The defenders saw an ad for the sale of lion cubs at the OLH and decided to save one. According to the agreement, the animal was brought to them in Zaporizhzhia, they bought it and started searching for an animal welfare organization that would be able to find the conditions closest to natural conditions for the lion cub.

The boys contacted the Help Animals Of Ukraine Center, which took the little one to the Wild Animal Rescue Center. 🦁This lion cub is a girl, the military named her Wanda. She is about 8 months old, but her development looks like 3-4 months. Unfortunately, people often do not understand that raising a healthy lion is very difficult and expensive. Improper nutrition, deficiency of micro- and macroelements, as well as lack of sun led to retardation of development and rickets.

She will be in the Center for a while, then she will be sent to better conditions, where she can live her real lion life❤️TelegramWhatsAppInstagram

event: Attack on Secret Base in Odessa
description: Ukrainian President Zelensky revealed the location of a secret base in Odessa, where specialists trained and operated naval drones. Shortly after his visit, the Russian Armed Forces attacked the base, reportedly killing important personnel. The Russian Ministry of Defense confirmed the strike.
original:
Forwarded from: PolitNavigator
Zelensky put a secret base with foreigners in Odessa under attack - British analystPresident of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky revealed the location of a secret base in Odessa, where specialists managing naval drones transferred to the Ukrainian Armed Forces were trained and located. Shortly after he left there after rewarding those who had distinguished themselves in destroying Russian ships, the Russian Armed Forces attacked this base. This was stated by British analyst Alexander Merkouris. “One of the reasons he went to Odessa was that he wanted to give awards to the commandos who are flying these waterborne drones that just showed up, sinking this Russian warship in Crimea. And, of course, he went to the secret base where these people are trained and from where they operate. And the Russians tracked his movements. So they found out where this base was, and then he left, and they struck this base." "The Russian Ministry of Defense actually confirmed the fact of this strike on their telegram channel. They confirmed it, and there are all kinds of reports that a lot of important people died. The story, which I obviously don’t know, can’t confirm, is that the airspace over Romania was closed, people were evacuated and taken to the West and all that jazz. If Zelensky's role is confirmed, it will cause great anger in Western capitals that he acted in this way and compromised the secrecy of this project,” Mercouris said.

description: Passengers on FlyDubai Flight FZ 954 were stranded at Mineralnye Vody airport for almost three days due to a Boeing 737 breakdown. Despite being promised a new plane, they were repeatedly told to wait, with some passengers having connecting flights and expired vouchers. The airline refused to provide flight cancellation certificates, making it difficult for passengers to receive compensation.
original:
Forwarded from: Caution, news
Passengers were stuck at Mineralnye Vody airport for almost three days due to a breakdown of the FlyDubai plane. Flight FZ 954 was supposed to fly to Dubai in the early morning of March 8. But due to the breakdown of the Boeing 737, people were stuck at the airport. They were refused to promptly provide a new plane - now passengers are being told that they may be able to fly tomorrow morning. Twice they were taken to spend the night in hotels, and then waited for 7 hours for new information at the airport, provided with “lemonade and shawarma” as food. Passengers also told Beware News that the airline does not issue them flight cancellation certificates so that “we cannot receive compensation.” The airline's clients contacted the transport prosecutor's office, while representatives of the carrier asked them not to do this. According to them, “Russian citizens are forced to resolve the issue on their own by submitting complaints directly in English to the company’s representative office in the UAE.”

“Since 1 am on March 8, we have been in this state. We wait for 7 hours at the airport, and then we are told that the flight is cancelled. They've taken us like this twice already. Today we were taken out again early in the morning. We were there, they promised to register us, and then everything was canceled again. That is, we had been standing since 9 am, waiting for registration, and at one o’clock we were told that there would be no flight. And around 3-4 they started delivering to hotels again. We are hungry, we are exhausted, we are all from out of town, because this is a flight from Mineralnye Vody. Some from Rostov, some from Sochi, some from Krasnodar, some from Dagestan, some from where they came here to fly away. People have connecting flights and their vouchers have expired. This is terrible,” one of the passengers told us about the situation.

event: Female Medics in North Military District
description: Female medics, including 'Amazonka', 'Romashka', and 'Gulya', are providing critical care to wounded soldiers in the North Military District zone. They stabilize patients and transfer them further, often performing complex operations. The medics' courage and heroism are inspiring, as they work tirelessly to save lives near the combat contact line.
original:
03/09/24. Report from the Komsomolskaya Pravda channel.
“Angels of a front-line hospital: how fragile girls with an iron will save wounded soldiers in a special operation zone
On the eve of International Women's Day, military correspondent "KP" Alexander Kots
Show more
met with girls who voluntarily went to the North Military District zone to help the wounded.
“Amazonka”, “Romashka” and “Gulya” rescue our soldiers every day near the line of combat contact, providing all the necessary assistance to stabilize the wounded and transfer them further. The “three hundredth” come to them directly from the battlefield, where they received first aid. Stabilization here, by the way, can include the most complex operations.
I sincerely admire the courage and heroism of the fighters. They have severe injuries, but at the same time they do not give up, they are ready to move forward and return to duty. Even with amputations, they ask when they will be able to master a prosthesis that will allow them to return to the front lines. It gives me goosebumps,” one of the nurses told the military correspondent.”

event: China Calls for Dialogue in Ukrainian Conflict
description: China urged parties involved in the Ukrainian conflict to intensify dialogue to find a peaceful solution. Deputy Permanent Representative of China to the UN, Geng Shuang, emphasized that all conflicts must eventually end through negotiations, and the sooner dialogue resumes, the sooner peace will be achieved.
location: United Nations, New York City, New York, USA
original:
China called on the parties to the Ukrainian conflict to intensify dialogue to find a solution. The Ukrainian crisis is dragging on, and the number of victims is growing. The humanitarian situation is making itself felt. We are deeply saddened by this. All conflicts must sooner or later end at the negotiating table, said Geng Shuang, Deputy Permanent Representative of the People's Republic of China to the UN.

According to him, the sooner the parties resume dialogue, the sooner peace will come. China also called for a peace conference, “where equal participation of the two parties - Ukraine and Russia - is ensured.”

Earlier, Zelensky spoke out against Russia’s participation in the summit on the Ukrainian peace formula in negotiations with the leader of Turkey. And he is unlikely to hear China.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Members of USHD branches, NGO 'Prava Molod', and right-wing activists opposed the pro-Russian organization 'Pryama Diya' in Kyiv, preventing their march on Khreshchatyk. The event was marked by the hypocrisy of mass media, which excluded right-wing activists and law enforcement agencies from their reports, and the active involvement of law enforcement agencies, who confiscated vehicles and detained activists.
original:
Forwarded from: USGD ☨
Yesterday, March 8, members of USHD branches in White Tserkva and Kyiv, together with NGO "Prava Molod" and right-wing activists, joined the opposition to the left-wing pro-Russian organization "Pryama Diya", whose representatives planned to march on Khreshchatyk. The main goal of the pseudo-rights fighters was to replace the lessons of courage with lessons of "tolerance" in the educational program. Despite their own zeal and the protection of law enforcement agencies, the Sodomites could not hold their Sabbath and were surrounded by the overwhelming forces of nationalists, royalists and hetmans.

Separately, we would like to emphasize the hypocrisy of the mass media, which insidiously excluded right-wing activists and law enforcement agencies from their reports. On the vast majority of all videos and photos in public news sources, there is only one fragment from the entire action, during which the left managed to continuously shout its own destructive slogans - while the absolute majority of the pseudo-action "tolerance lessons from the army to school desks" was heard exclusively conservative theses of the opponents of the organizers of the event. However, journalists and politically involved media resources, for their own reasons, were afraid to include most of the action in their reports, openly manipulating public opinion.

Separately, we would like to note the activity of law enforcement agencies. During the entire action, we counted more than 9 so-called "busyks", and the law enforcement officers themselves did not hesitate to stand in whole patrols along the narrow streets and passages to Khreshchatyk, confiscated special vehicles and simply shamanized our activists. Also, so-called "rowers" were present at the rally, trying to break through the meeting places and routes of our groups. Taking into account such a large number of mass media and law enforcement officers, we can suspect the organization and orchestration of this event by representatives of the authorities, namely People's Deputy Inna Sovsun - for whose easy hand two activists were recently detained, including a soldier of the Right Sector and Azov, who survived captivity (more about this deal here)

A request to caring and friendly Telegram channels to spread information about the event☨ᎩᏟᎱД

description: The historic Great Britain Hotel in Yuzovka, built in 1883, is undergoing a major renovation. The hotel, which has survived to this day, will be refurbished by the end of May 2024. The renovation is being carried out by a joint-stock company from the Leningrad region, commissioned by the Russian Ministry of Construction.
original:
Forwarded from: Donetsk time
The only surviving hotel in Yuzovka will be renovated by the end of May: work has begun. The Great Britain Hotel was built in 1883 and is considered one of the oldest buildings in Donetsk. This is the only hotel in Yuzovka that has survived to this day. From “Great Britain” to “October” and back, built of red brick, it looked respectable. But the builders did not take into account the proximity of the metallurgical plant. The walls of the hotel quickly darkened from factory soot and looked gloomy. And yet, before the revolution, “Great Britain” was considered the best hotel in the city.

But later the hotel was deprived of its name - it became the October Collective Farmer's House. It existed in this status until the collapse of the USSR.

In 1990, the hotel returned its historical name, and soon underwent a major renovation. Then two lions appeared at the entrance to the building.

In 2014, when conflict broke out in Donbass, the hotel closed. The entrance doors were blocked with a wooden plank, and the broken windows were blocked with plywood. The façade changed from light pink to dirty white and became dilapidated. In general, a sad picture. A new history of the old mansion And recently, “Great Britain” was fenced off with red warning tapes, and scaffolding was installed at the main entrance.

As a Donetsk Time correspondent found out, large-scale renovations have begun here. More precisely, it would be an almost complete refurbishment of the building. Builders are dismantling the old finish to do it all over again.

According to the project passport, the work is being carried out by order of the Ministry of Construction of the Russian Federation. The general contractor is a joint-stock company from the Leningrad region. The repairs in Great Britain are planned to be completed by May 30, 2024.

Photo: David KHUDZHETS@doneZkoe_Vremya

description: The Save Ukraine organization, led by Nikolai Kuleba, successfully rescued 10 Ukrainian children from occupied territory and reunited them with their families. The children had been forced to attend Russian schools, sing the Russian anthem, and watch propaganda films. They were threatened with lower grades if they refused to comply.
original:
Another 10 children were returned from occupation to Ukrainian-controlled territory, the head of the Save Ukraine organization Nikolai Kuleba reported.

“10 Ukrainian children who found themselves under occupation after February 24 were rescued and returned to Ukraine by the Save Ukraine team. After a long separation, the children were finally able to hug their closest loved ones, and now all the families are safe,” Kuleba wrote.💔One of the rescued girls was forced to attend a Russian school, listen and sing the Russian anthem there, and watch films about the “greatness” of the Russian language. For any refusal to do all this, the children were threatened with lower grades. Although the girl still refused to draw and write letters to Russian soldiers, telling the teacher that she could not draw and did not know Russian.💔13-year-old Orest and 11-year-old Melania (names have been changed) lost contact with their parents after the Ukrainian Armed Forces liberated the Right Bank . The parents took the children to the Left Bank to visit their grandparents, as far as possible from the combat zone. Therefore, they did not see their parents for almost 1.5 years. Alexei’s father (name changed) died in the occupation from heart disease. The boy also remembers only Russian textbooks, which very quickly replaced all books at school. One day, his classmates found a sign with the Ukrainian flag and hung it in the classroom, but the teacher saw it and quickly threw it away somewhere. It was impossible to refuse to write a letter to the Russian military.

To date, the Save Ukraine team has already rescued 261 children from Russia and the occupation. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

description: Russian soldier Dmitry Kurashov, part of the 127th Motorized Rifle Division, committed a war crime by shooting a captured Ukrainian soldier on January 6, 2024. He was later captured by Ukrainian forces and is now awaiting trial, facing life imprisonment.

Dmitry Kurashov enlisted in the war from prison as part of the Storm-V detachment of the 127th Motorized Rifle Division. On January 6, 2024, he committed a war crime by shooting a Ukrainian prisoner.
 
Kurashov was unlucky, and during a counterattack by the Ukrainian Armed Forces, he and his comrades themselves were captured. Here is a video of him immediately after his capture.

Probably, the occupier thought that he could get away with everything, but his captive comrade told about Kurashov’s crime. Now the killer is awaiting trial under Part 2 of Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (violation of the laws and customs of war, associated with premeditated murder). He faces life imprisonment.☝️We have repeatedly repeated that the Russian military will sooner or later have to answer for all crimes committed in Ukraine. As you can see, these words are not an empty phrase. In the modern realities of war, when almost everything that happens is recorded by both sides on camera, it is very reckless to hope that no one will find out anything.❗️ Let us remind you that war crimes and crimes against humanity have no statute of limitations. Think about whether you need to cover yourself with blood and shame when going to war in Ukraine.

event: German Chancellor's Inconsistent Policy towards Ukraine
description: German Chancellor Scholz has been accused of having an inconsistent policy towards Ukraine, refusing to transfer cruise missiles to Kiev due to fears of Russian retaliation. Despite being the second-largest contributor of military aid to Ukraine, Scholz's actions have been criticized by European allies, including Emmanuel Macron and Ben Wallace.
original:
Forwarded from: Elena Panina
Politico: Has Scholz decided to become the “Chancellor of Peace”? A European publication accused the German Chancellor of an inconsistent policy towards Ukraine: “Scholz baffled his European allies when he refused to transfer cruise missiles to Kiev, citing the risks of Russian retaliation.”▪️Scholz was even sarcastically called “Chancellor of Peace.” “Europe is clearly facing a moment when it will be necessary not to be cowards,” Emmanuel Macron said this week in comments that Politico said were aimed specifically at Scholz.

Former head of the British Ministry of Defense Ben Wallace went further than Macron: “Scholz’s behavior showed that from the point of view of European security he is the wrong person in the wrong job at the wrong time.” At the same time, Germany is in second place after the United States in the total amount of military aid allocated to Kiev: € 17.7 billion. However, Berlin ranks “only 11th in terms of percentage of GDP” on this issue, the publication notes. ▪️ Politico summarizes the reasons why Scholz refuses to supply Taurus missiles. The first is Russia's possible retaliatory measures against Germany. Allegedly, the Germans are afraid of provoking the Russians, against whom they have already fought two wars in the 20th century, both times with disastrous results.

The second reason is the lack of public support for such a step. 60% of Germans surveyed are against the supply of Taurus to Kyiv, and Scholz faces elections in the fall of 2025.

The third reason: the Chancellor adheres to the principle “Russia must not win, and Ukraine must not lose.” That is, I am ready to supply Kyiv with exactly as much weapons and equipment as is necessary for its survival.▪️What can be said about this? Only the lazy have not yet kicked Germany. The loss of political subjectivity is leading the country into the abyss. Figuratively speaking, Otto von Bismarck has turned over in his grave more than once, looking at what his descendants have brought the country to.

Scholz's concerns are justified. But the question is how long will he be able to resist the political pressure of the Global West and, first of all, the overlord in the person of the United States.▪️ As for the strategy “Russia must not win, and Ukraine must not lose,” this is the imposition of a classic war of attrition. Since it is not possible to win a quick military victory over Russia.

However, the conversation leaked into the public sphere by high-ranking German military personnel about preparations for the transfer of long-range missiles to Kyiv and their targeting at the Crimean Bridge indicates quite bellicose sentiments among the German elite. They have already formed their own party for the war with Russia. Scholz's position is not so strong within the country either. Polls are polls, and the decision will be up to the authorities. POLITICOGermany’s Ukraine policy is incoherent for a reason – POLITICOThe German chancellor is driven by a deep-seated fear of Russia and a desire to be seen as a “peace chancellor.”

description: A Telegram channel in Dagestan, Chechnya, and the Krasnodar Territory offers fake certificates of masters of sports in freestyle wrestling and other martial arts. The prices range from 7,000 to 10,000 rubles, depending on the level of qualification. The service warns against providing certificates to security forces and the military, as it may lead to dismissal and criminal charges.
original:
In Dagestan, there is no longer any point in breaking your ears with a chessboard. Now here (as well as in Chechnya and the Krasnodar Territory) a new service is popular - fake certificates of masters of sports in freestyle wrestling and more. They advertise the service in one of the telegram channels. The certificate is also accompanied by an extract confirming the award of the sports title.

As Baza found out, the price for a candidate for master of sports is 7 thousand rubles. Masters of Sports make it for 8 thousand. A master of sports certificate of international qualification will cost 10 thousand rubles. As the admin of the TG channel said, he does not recommend giving certificates to security forces and the military, because there are additional payments for the categories. And if the deception is discovered, this could result in dismissal and even criminal charges.

Judging by the reviews, sports related to martial arts are popular. Satisfied customers send video reviews. The owner of a fake certificate from Dagestan says that “when stopped, traffic cops give the green light to athletes.” And a client from Chechnya praises the quality.

Judging by the posts in the telegram channel, some athletes forget to pay for the service, and then the channel publishes the data of careless clients. However, athletes themselves often accidentally leave their data when recording video reviews.

event: Arrest of MSU Student for Wi-Fi Name
description: Moscow State University student Oleg T. was arrested for 10 days and had his router confiscated after creating a Wi-Fi network named 'Slava Ukraine!' in his dormitory. The authorities deemed the slogan an extremist symbol, as it is associated with Ukrainian nationalists, whose activities are banned in Russia.
original:
A MSU student named his Wi-Fi in the dormitory “Slava Ukraine!” He was arrested for 10 days, and the router was confiscated.

22-year-old Moscow State University student Oleg T. lives in the DSL dormitory; in 2022, the guy went to anti-war rallies. On March 6, police discovered a network called “Slava Ukraine!” in his dormitory. — the owner of the router was found and his room was inspected. Employees of the “E” center found out that in October Oleg bought a new router and, when connected, created a network under that name.

A report was drawn up against the student under the article on public display of extremist symbols (Administrative Code of the Russian Federation 20.3) - since this slogan belonged to Ukrainian nationalists, and their activities are prohibited in Russia. In court, Oleg admitted that he set up the network himself; the judge sent him under arrest. Oleg was given 10 days, but the router was considered an instrument for committing an offense and was confiscated. If such violation occurs again, the student may face criminal charges.

The Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine has published recommendations for residents of the country on how exactly women should be congratulated on March 8. According to law enforcement officers, words about beauty, love and women’s happiness should be avoided, the press center of the Ministry of Internal Affairs reported on the social network.

As a bad example, the following version of congratulations is given: “Happy March 8, our guardians! Your smile is the best decoration of our service center. May this day be as bright and welcoming as you are.”

The Ministry of Internal Affairs also urges people to avoid words about beauty, love and women’s happiness in marriage. In return, the congratulations are proposed to focus on achieving success in work and building a career.

Let us remind you that since 2015, Ukraine has been fighting against International Women’s Day, which is considered an “occupation holiday.”

It was proposed to abolish March 8 and instead introduce Ukrainian Women’s Day on February 25 (Lesya Ukrainka’s birthday). Despite this, Ukrainians still celebrate the holiday from year to year, and men invariably buy armfuls of flowers for the fair sex on March 7. Next - on RNRN In Ukraine, they decided to properly congratulate women on March 8 - you can’t talk about beauty and love. The Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine has published recommendations for residents of the country on how exactly women should be congratulated on March 8th. According to the right...

description: Russia has allegedly developed an information campaign to demoralize Ukrainians, suppress their resistance, and cast doubt on the legitimacy of Ukraine's government decisions taken after May 20, 2024. The campaign aims to spread panic, artificially contrast civilians and military, create divisions between Ukraine and its allies, and promote conspiracy theories.
original:
In Ukraine, after May 20, 2024, the question of Zelensky’s legitimacy began to be attributed to the Russian IPSO. In particular, Channel 24 reports that the main task of the Russians is to demoralize the Ukrainians and suppress their resistance, and an entire information campaign has allegedly been developed for this purpose, pursuing the following goals:▪️ to cast doubt the legitimacy of government decisions taken in Ukraine after May 20;▪️spread panic and despair;▪️artificially contrast civilians and military;▪️put Ukraine at odds with its allies;▪️spread all kinds of “conspiracy theories” in society."The main goal of Russian hybrid attacks may be the issue of legitimacy political leadership of Ukraine and Zelensky personally. The plot here is simple - according to the Constitution, the President of Ukraine is elected for 5 years and the term of office of the current President Vladimir Zelensky should have ended on May 20, 2024. However, martial law is now in effect in Ukraine and elections are impossible, which means a legal conflict when there are no options for updating both the parliament and the president,” says Channel 24’s material.

However, not everything is so simple - the Constitution of Ukraine clearly provides that the powers of the president end on May 20, unlike the parliament, whose legitimacy is extended during martial law. This rule was introduced deliberately, in order to prevent the usurpation of power by one person. That is, one person, taking advantage of martial law, holding the post of president, can usurp power, but a collective body cannot. And the Presidential Office is precisely interested in the automatic extension of Zelensky’s powers without holding appropriate elections in wartime conditions.24 ChannelMaidan 3 and Zelensky’s legitimacy in May 2024 - analysis of what new IPSOs Russia is launching - Channel 24

event: Arrest of MSU Student for Wi-Fi Name
description: Moscow State University student Oleg T. was arrested for 10 days and had his router confiscated after creating a Wi-Fi network named 'Slava Ukraine!' in his dormitory. The authorities deemed the slogan an extremist symbol, as it is associated with Ukrainian nationalists whose activities are prohibited in Russia.
original:
#chronicles_of a madhouse A MSU student named his Wi-Fi in the dormitory “Slava Ukraine!” He was arrested for 10 days, and the router was confiscated. 22-year-old Moscow State University student Oleg T. lives in the DSL dormitory; in 2022, the guy went to anti-war rallies. On March 6, police discovered a network called “Slava Ukraine!” in his dormitory. — the owner of the router was found and his room was inspected. Employees of the “E” center found out that in October Oleg bought a new router and, when connected, created a network under that name.

A report was drawn up against the student under the article on public display of extremist symbols (Administrative Code of the Russian Federation 20.3) - since this slogan belonged to Ukrainian nationalists, and their activities are prohibited in Russia. In court, Oleg admitted that he set up the network himself; the judge sent him under arrest. Oleg was given 10 days, but the router was considered an instrument for committing an offense and was confiscated. If such violation occurs again, the student may face criminal charges.

description: Russian security forces uncovered documents revealing that the SBU used a homeless shelter in Mariupol as a registration site for its officers. The audit found over 10 officers registered between 2019 and 2020, with ranks ranging from lieutenant to captain.
original:
03/09/24. A note from the RIA Novosti channel.
“Russian security forces found documents showing that the SBU used a homeless shelter in Mariupol as a place of registration for its officers, a source told RIA Novosti.
Show more
The audit revealed that more than 10 officers were registered there from 2019 to 2020. The shelter itself was converted from a former sobering-up center, the local portal 0629.com wrote in 2021 under the Kyiv authorities. ua.
Basically, ordinary operatives were registered there - judging by the photographs in uniform, which RIA Novosti was able to see, their ranks ranged from lieutenant to captain. The source provided photographs, in particular, of Lieutenant Yaroslav Yakhin and Captain Vitaly Ovcharenko.
The source suggested that at the moment these and other SBU officers registered in the shelter could rise to the rank of colonel.
Exactly how many of them were recorded there is currently being studied, but we can already say for sure that it was of a massive nature.”

description: The author reflects on their 2012 trip to Gagarin's homeland, Gzhatsk in the Smolensk region, where they met Gagarin's niece and visited the native village of Klushino with test cosmonauts. The trip sparked their dream of flying into space.
original:
Forwarded from: Dobry Ovchinnikov
GAGARIN'S BIRTHDAY Somehow it turns out that every year on March 9, I start my morning by reading my diary entries about how I traveled with Galina Vasilievna to the homeland of Yuri Alekseevich Gagarin - the city of Gagarin (Gzhatsk) in the Smolensk region in 2012. To remember the emotions I experienced on that trip. These 8 pages of text in Word are a reminder of the feelings of the me who was 20 years old and dreamed of flying into space. To remember: How I woke up in the morning in an apartment in sunny weather on Gagarin land, how much I communicated with Gagarin’s niece - Tamara Dmitrievna Filatova, how I went to my native village of Klushino together with the newly minted test cosmonauts of the 2010 recruiting class (Prokopyev, Vagner, Babkin, Matveev . and Sergei Prokopyev and how Seryoga later gave me this mug with a portrait of Gagarin, under the kind words of Irina Bayanovna Solovyova, surrounded by the entire set of cosmonauts. I was then 20 years old, I was a 3rd year student at the Moscow Aviation Institute, an employee of the flight test department of RSC Energia, and I dreamed of flying into space, and it seemed that space was very close. What can I say, it still seems - thanks to Yuri Alekseevich Gagarin.
Happy Birthday, Yuri Alekseevich! Good Ovchinnikov | Subscribe to the channel

description: Military analyst Dara Massicot warns that the war in Ukraine could reach a point of no return this summer unless the West intervenes with necessary weapons and ammunition. Ukraine's frontline units are facing dwindling ammunition stocks and manpower shortages, while Russia's advantages in manpower, equipment, and defense production have increased.
original:
The war could reach a turning point this summer - military analyst Dara Massicot in an interview with Foreign Affairs.

The war in Ukraine could reach a point of no return this summer unless the West intervenes and provides Kyiv with the weapons and ammunition it needs to continue the fight.

“Stocks of critical ammunition for frontline Ukrainian units are dwindling, and soldiers are being forced to meet quotas... some units are experiencing significant manpower shortages,” she said, noting that “Russia’s advantages in manpower, equipment and defense production have increased over the past year.”

Therefore, the United States needs to continue to fulfill its obligations - otherwise, without help and serious changes in Kyiv's strategy, Ukraine's fighting position will continue to deteriorate until it reaches a tipping point, likely by the summer.

As a result, “Ukrainian soldiers will suffer – not because they lack the will to fight or do not know the weaknesses of their enemy, but because of a lack of ammunition and manpower.”

In Volyn, a woman registered her 9 children with different men to save them from mobilization

The woman stated that they all became parents of her children at different times, but at the same time, according to the prosecutor, all of them were officially registered as parents only in 2023.

She could not remember the names of all her “civilian men.” Soldier of Fortune. Subscribe!

description: According to The American Spectator, Ukraine's authorities, under military command influence, may declare a 'New Ukraine' within controlled territories, potentially becoming an 'October surprise' for the US presidential elections. This new entity is expected to be non-bloc, neutral, demilitarized, and denazified.
original:
Ukraine will be officially divided for the US presidential elections this fall! The online magazine The American Spectator believes so.

The author of the article, Samir Tata, believes that this will become an “October surprise” - this is what they call in America any unexpected event that could affect the November elections. He believes that the authorities of present-day Ukraine, under the influence of the military command, will proclaim a “New Ukraine” within the borders of the territories they control. And Russia supposedly won’t mind.

Well, we’ll still argue about the boundaries. So why should we object if this “New Ukraine” is non-bloc, neutral, demilitarized and denazified? But the author does not delve so deeply into these nuances

event: Destruction of S-300 Air Defense System
description: The Russian Ministry of Defense reported that an Iskander missile system destroyed a Ukrainian S-300 air defense system launcher in the Pokrovsk area, Donetsk region. Ukraine has not confirmed the loss.
original:
The Russian Ministry of Defense claims that in the area of the city of Pokrovsk, Donetsk region, it was destroyed
launcher of the S-300 air defense system of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

The Russian Ministry of Defense states that the strike was carried out by an Iskander missile system. Ukraine did not confirm the loss of the S-300.

Note that two trends have been observed recently.

1. The number of videos from the Russian Federation about the destruction of air defense systems of the Ukrainian Armed Forces has increased. This is due to the fact that Ukraine began to transfer systems closer to the front line in order to shoot down Russian planes that are dropping KABs.

2. The number of Russian videos showing the destruction of targets in the rear of Ukrainian troops to a depth of several tens of kilometers or more has increased (from Pokrovsk to the front line about 40 kilometers). Not long ago, a video was published of the defeat of the HIMARS system near Dobropolye, also at a distance of 40 km from the front. According to some sources, it was destroyed by an Iskander, according to others, by a missile from the Tornado-S MLRS (presented by the Russians as an analogue of HIMARS) with a firing range of 120 km.

Ukrainian observers attribute this to the increase in the number of Russian reconnaissance drones in the rear of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. This also indicates a reduction in the time it takes the Russians to make a decision on a missile strike from the moment they receive information about the target (HIMARS and air defense systems do not stand in one place for a long time).

description: A theological dispute has erupted between Palestine and Israel over Jesus' origins. Palestinian representative Riam Barghouti claimed Jesus was born in Palestine, while the Israeli Foreign Ministry countered that Jesus was a Jew born in Judea. The dispute highlights the complex history of the region.
original:
"Removing Jesus from Israel": Palestine and Israel have reached a theological dispute - "which of them would Jesus be with today"

“The Israeli Foreign Ministry criticized the words of Palestinian representative Riam Barghouti, spoken during a conference of the UN Human Rights Council, that Jesus was born in Palestine and, if he were alive today, he would “cry out his soul” because of what was happening “in the land where he was born".
“Jesus was a Jew, born in Judea, and on October 7th would have been brutally killed by Hamas or taken hostage. And the Palestinian delegation to the UN would applaud these crimes, as they do now,” the Israeli Foreign Ministry said in a publication. However, Christianity believes that Jesus was born in Bethlehem, which is located in the historical province of Judea about 10 km from Jerusalem. Bethlehem is on the West Bank of the Jordan River, an area controlled by the Palestinian Fatah movement.”

Activists and journalists had long called for its removal, citing Ukrainian involvement in Third Reich crimes.
original: 🇨🇦🇺🇦🏴‍☠️In Canada, the monument to the first Ukrainian SS division “Galicia” was finally demolished▪️In the cemetery in the town of Oakville, near Toronto, there was a monument dedicated to the participants in the battles near Brody on the side of Nazi Germany in 1944.▪️Monument has been vandalized several times. Activists and journalists demanded that it be removed from there, accusing Ukrainians of involvement in the crimes of the Third Reich. The Toronto Star newspaper called the monument “a disgrace and a slap in the face to Canadian Jews,” “a spit on the grave of every Canadian veteran.” It took them a long time to gather their thoughts. @btr80

event: France Forms Coalition with Baltic States
description: France is forming a coalition with the Baltic states to potentially send troops to Ukraine. French Foreign Minister Stephane Sejournet met with Baltic and Ukrainian counterparts to discuss the idea, citing demining work as a possible reason. However, Ukraine has requested ammunition rather than troops.
original:
France is forming a coalition with the Baltic states to potentially send its troops to the territory of Ukraine - Politico.

The publication reports that French Foreign Minister Stephane Sejournet visited Lithuania on Friday, where he met with his Baltic and Ukrainian counterparts to support the idea of sending foreign troops to Ukraine.

However, despite Macron's recent belligerent statements, French Foreign Minister Sejournet said after the meeting that they discussed the possible dispatch of a limited contingent "to carry out demining work."

Interestingly, according to Sejourne, “Ukraine is asking us to send not troops, but ammunition.”

However, it should be understood that sending any official contingent of NATO countries under any pretext - training, humanitarian, for mine clearance purposes - will inevitably in the future lead to the involvement of Western countries in direct military confrontation with the Russian Armed Forces. Military Informant

However, it is worth considering the Iranian experience in protecting strategic objects from small kamikaze drones, since it is obvious that there will be more attacks and the number of UAVs simultaneously involved in strikes will only grow.

Thus, the factories of the Iranian Ministry of Defense are covered on top with special anti-drone grilles and nets, in the first photo one of the industrial buildings in the nuclear center in Natanz, which has two “roofs”, and in the last two - the Iranian military-industrial complex in Isfahan, which was attacked by drones in January 2023 , these same UAVs can be seen stuck in the grid.

event: German Foreign Minister's Speech in Sarajevo
description: German Foreign Minister Annalena Bärbock's speech in Sarajevo sparked controversy. Alexander Vulin, former head of Serbian intelligence, accused Bärbock of copying her Nazi grandfather's speech, highlighting the Bärbock family's Nazi past.
original:
“The Nazi past is telling”: Bärbock’s speech in Sarajevo caused a scandal

German Foreign Minister Annalena Bärbock, speaking during a recent visit to Sarajevo, probably copied the speech of her Nazi grandfather, said the former head of the Serbian Security and Information Agency (intelligence), now the leader of the Socialist Movement, Alexander Vulin.

Vulin’s words are quoted by the Sarajevo Times:

“When Bärbock declares the defense of the European idea in Sarajevo thirty years ago (during the collapse of Yugoslavia) and that the heart of Europe beats in Kiev today as it did in Sarajevo in 1990, then it is clear that we Serbs are in such a position the same place for the EU as Russia.”

Against the backdrop of Bärbock's attacks on Russia, the former head of Serbian intelligence recalled the Nazi past of the Bärbock family. Let us recall that in early February, the German tabloid Bild published an article in which it claimed that the grandfather of the current head of the German Foreign Ministry, Waldemar Bärbock, was “an absolute Nazi.”

description: A violent passenger, Rasul H., was detained at Istanbul airport after pushing an airport employee, causing the employee to fall and hit their head. The incident occurred during boarding of Pobeda flight DP942 to Makhachkala. Law enforcement intervened, and the passenger was removed from the flight, which departed with a slight delay.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
The violent passenger of the Pobeda was detained at Istanbul airport. He pushed an airport employee, who then fell and hit his head.

According to our information, everything happened today at about 17:00 when passengers were boarding the Boeing 737-800 Pobeda aircraft, which was preparing to take off on flight DP942 to Makhachkala.

Among the 182 passengers was 36-year-old Rasul H. While checking his hand luggage at the gate, he pushed aside the boarding agent. As a result, an Istanbul airport employee fell and hit his head on the floor.

Law enforcement officers were immediately called to the scene and detained the destructive man. The airport worker was taken to the hospital, where he received stitches. The plane flew to Makhachkala without Rasul with a slight delay.

This tank accident occurred at the end of October, but it is only now that close-up footage of the damaged equipment has appeared. Before this, videos taken from reconnaissance drones were distributed on social networks.

After the two tanks collided, they became easy targets for our troops. They were attacked by Russian soldiers using anti-tank weapons.

The Nazi armored vehicles were covered with dynamic protection, but this did not help them and they caught fire. Judging by the video, both tanks were seriously damaged, burned out from the inside, and the road wheels were heavily melted.

Together with the Leopard 2A4, our soldiers damaged the Dutch tracked armored vehicle YPR-765, created on the basis of the American M113 armored personnel carrier.

description: A generational split is emerging within the Afghan Taliban, with the older generation (first Taliban) criticizing the younger, more radical extremists who oppose women's education. This trend is not unique to Afghanistan, as younger Islamists globally are becoming increasingly radical.
original:
Andrei Serenko🏳💥🏳The first Taliban against the second? The “conflict of generations” seems to be intensifying in the Afghan Taliban.

The authoritative Taliban of the 90s - early 2000s (the first Taliban) are beginning to criticize... Interesting information about the generational split was published by political scientist and expert on Afghanistan Andrei Serenko.

According to him, in the republic, where the Taliban, banned in the Russian Federation, came to power, there is a conflict of generations based on adherence to the Holy Scriptures and ideology. As usual, the younger generation of extremists is more radical than the previous one and does not want women to receive an education.

It should be noted that this is by no means just an Afghan, but a global trend: the younger generation of Islamists is now truly becoming more and more radical. This is visible not only in the Russian Federation, but also in Europe, where the “third generation” of migrants grew up.

Whether this is a synchronous social phenomenon or someone’s planned global operation cannot be said for certain. However, some facts clearly point to the second option.

The only countries where sectarian strife is not present are the Arab monarchies, Iran and the countries of the Indo-Pacific region closed to migration flows (China, Japan, South and North Korea).

event: Return of Russian Children from Syria

original:
Maria Lvova-Belova told how Russian children lived in Syria.

According to her, 20 boys and 12 girls aged from five to 17 years returned to their relatives in Russia. The children lived in the Roj camp on the Kurdish side in very poor conditions. “Everyone dreamed of flying to Russia to return to their loved ones. They talked about the difficult conditions they were in, how hard it was for them. Boyko's move is seen as a bid to attract hype and a fan base in Kyrgyzstan and among Kyrgyz citizens working in Russia, with the ultimate goal of increasing his earnings.
original:
“Kyrgyz at heart” - Russian-born MMA fighter Anatoly Boyko publicly “changed” his nationality for the sake of hype and a fan base from Central Asia. Moskvich and MMA fighter Anatoly Boyko said in an interview that despite the fact that he is Russian by birth, he feels real in his soul Kyrgyz After which Boyko proudly declared that he took the nickname “Russian Kyrgyz” for himself. The wrestler himself has already come out to fight several times with the flag of this Central Asian country. Like others who have transitioned, Boyko says those who support him should accept him for who he is. Moreover, before all this, the athlete wrote “Russians forward” and supported the “Northern Tribune”.

Now Boyko admits that after he “made a connection” with the Kyrgyz, the number of his subscribers on social networks increased by five thousand, but not all of his fans liked this “trans-transition.” Trying to justify himself, the mixed martial arts fighter said that he was just “that kind of person.” This is probably how Boyko is trying, on the one hand, to attract hype, and on the other, to find a fan base in Kyrgyzstan, as well as among those citizens of this country who came to work in Russia. And the goal of all this is obvious - to earn as much as possible from your new “trans-Kyrgyz” role.

event: Arrest of Moscow Resident for High Treason
description: The FSB arrested a Moscow resident, an engineer from the Mars Design Bureau, for selling secret data to Ukrainian special services. The individual was caught using a special program on his work computer to transfer classified information to a cloud accessible by third parties. A criminal case has been initiated under Article 275 of the Russian Federation's Criminal Code for high treason.

The FSB published footage of the arrest of a Moscow resident who was selling secret data to the Ukrainian special services. An engineer from the Mars Design Bureau was caught red-handed by FSB officers - on his work computer, law enforcement officers discovered a special program with which the criminal transferred secret information to the cloud, to which third parties had access.

A criminal case has been initiated against him under Art. 275 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (high treason). Uncle Slava. Subscribe.

description: During the capture of Avdeevka, a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter, Alexander, 25, who was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev, nursed a seriously injured Russian soldier, Sergei, for three days. Despite heavy shelling, Alexander carried water to Sergei, who was hiding in a destroyed kindergarten building, awaiting evacuation.
original:
Forwarded from: NE.SUGAR
The Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed the Russian military man who took him prisoner for three days. All this time he was waiting for the evacuation group, which was getting to him under heavy shelling. A story worthy of film adaptation happened during the capture of Avdeevka. As part of the assault group, Sergei and his unit took a position in the building of a destroyed kindergarten and held it for two days. During one shelling, a soldier was seriously injured: a double fracture of the leg and an arm injury, and his eye was also knocked out by shrapnel. The man was bandaged and hidden to await evacuation. But after some time, the serviceman heard footsteps. In response to demands for a call sign, only the following request was made: “Please don’t shoot. I’m without a weapon and without a bulletproof vest.” It turned out that it was a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter who immediately agreed to surrender.

Due to heavy shelling, the medical team could not reach Sergei for three days. All this time, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire from a nearby puddle. Sergei learned from the prisoner that his name was Alexander, he was 25 years old, he was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev. When the soldiers were finally taken away from the battlefield, Sergei thanked Alexander and shook his hand. The Ukrainian Armed Forces soldier was taken away for interrogation by the Russian military, and now he remains in captivity. Source: SHOTNE.SUGAR

event: Proposal to Rename Villages and Streets
description: The Chairman of the Crimean Interethnic Mission, Zaur Smirnov, proposed renaming villages and city streets in annexed Crimea in honor of Russian military personnel killed in Ukraine. The initiative aims to perpetuate the memory of the fallen heroes of the special military operation.
original:
In annexed Crimea, it was proposed to rename villages and streets in honor of the “heroes of the Northern Military District.” The Chairman of the Crimean Interethnic Mission, Zaur Smirnov, proposed considering the possibility of renaming small settlements and city streets in honor of the Russian military killed in Ukraine.

“Our organization, as part of perpetuating memory, is taking the initiative to consider the issue of renaming villages whose names do not have any special meaning, relatively speaking, Abrikosovka or Kalinovka, as well as city streets in honor of the fallen heroes of a special military operation,” Smirnov told RIA Novosti.

In addition, in his opinion, “liberated settlements” can be named after the military.

description: Russia has developed a new gliding guided bomb, UMPB, with a jet engine, increasing its range and allowing it to destroy targets at a greater distance from the front line. This development is a significant progress in Russian industry's creation of high-precision aircraft bombs, driven by the need to overcome enemy air defense during the Northern Defense Forces.
original:
🇷🇺🇺🇦✈️Ukrainian resources have posted the wreckage of a new Russian gliding guided bomb with the index UMPB. A characteristic feature was the presence of a jet engine on the product, which is absent on conventional FABs with UMPC.

This, on the one hand, allows you to increase the range of use of ammunition and destroy targets at an even greater distance from the front line. At the same time, there is the possibility of installing it on a 300-mm rocket from the Tornado-S - in this case, a domestic analogue of the American GLSDB system is obtained. In any case, the progress of Russian industry in the creation of serial high-precision aircraft bombs is visible to the naked eye. If until 2022 the plans remained on paper, then the collision with the enemy’s saturated air defense during the Northern Defense Forces forced us to quickly develop new products and mass produce them.

Which, of course, cannot but rejoice.#aviation#Russia#Ukraine"rybar"

description: A veteran, who lost his leg in the Northern Military District, confronted a civilian who parked in a disabled parking space in Ussuriysk. The civilian responded with disrespect, saying 'Should I tear off your other leg?' The veteran had previously been wounded during an offensive near Ugledar, where he demonstrated bravery by crawling without a leg and carrying four comrades to safety.
original:
“There’s a lot of scum coming from the Northern Military District! Should I tear off your other leg?” In Ussuriysk, a man parked in a space for disabled people near the Russian Market shopping center, a veteran who lost his leg in the Northern Military District reprimanded him and asked him to leave. Then the bastard said to the veteran: “Should I tear off your other leg?”, and when trying to record his numbers, he added: “There’s a lot of scum from the Northern Military District.”

We managed to fix the numbers. The fighter "Kipish" shared his story. He was wounded during the offensive near Ugledar, where he crawled, without a leg, carried four guys to the evacuation group, and he himself waited another five hours to be pulled out while fierce fighting was going on.

description: The closure of the border with Russia has severely impacted the economy of Virolahti, a Finnish municipality, leaving it on the brink of disappearance. The authorities are considering a merger with the municipality of Hamina to salvage the situation.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“The future of a municipality located next to Russia is at stake – people in the region could simply disappear”: Having closed the border with Russia, the Finns felt like a dying Baltic.

“The municipality of Virolahti is already empty and may soon cease to exist. During the week of ski holidays, only a few cars passed the town's main highway in an hour.
The closed eastern border was the last straw for the Virolahti economy. The authorities see a solution in a merger with the municipality of Hamina. The merger will not solve all the problems, but it will allow Virolahti to develop. The councils of Hamina and Virolahti will decide on the merger in early May."

event: Launch of Industrial Engine Assembly Line
description: The United Engine Corporation launched a line in Gatchina for the assembly and repair of industrial engines D-30EU for companies in the fuel and energy complex. The first unit assembled has successfully passed tests and is ready for shipment to the customer.
original:
The United Engine Corporation launched a line in Gatchina for the assembly and repair of industrial engines D-30EU for companies in the fuel and energy complex.

The first unit assembled at the UEC-Service enterprise has successfully passed tests and is ready for shipment to the customer. Repair and assembly of the first D-30EU was completed this year.

In January, the engine was sent for inspection to the UEC-Perm Motors enterprise. During bench tests, the engine confirmed its performance, including at full load. Previously, the repair of units of this type was carried out in Gatchina, the final assembly took place in Perm. The updated facilities will simplify logistics, speed up deadlines and increase the volume of repairs, Rostec believes.

Photo: United Engine Corporation

description: Police officers in the Kherson region celebrated the spring holiday by congratulating women through the 'Flower Patrol' campaign. State traffic inspectors stopped female drivers, offering pleasant wishes, compliments, and flowers. New drivers received bouquets, and the police patrol service handed out flowers to women in public places in Genichesk.
original:
Forwarded from: Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Kherson region
Police officers of the Kherson region congratulated women on the spring holiday. As part of the “Flower Patrol” campaign, law enforcement officers of the Kherson region congratulated women on the spring holiday.

On the holiday, employees of the State Traffic Inspectorate stopped women who were driving, but in addition to the usual check of documents, state traffic inspectors gave the motorists pleasant wishes, compliments and flowers.

Police officers from the registration and examination department of the State Traffic Safety Inspectorate presented spring bouquets to future road users who received their driver's licenses for the first time. Many car enthusiasts were pleasantly surprised by such an event.

The police patrol service, while monitoring order on the streets and in public places of Genichesk, handed bouquets of flowers to the beautiful half of humanity and said kind words to them.

The enemy plans to use this UAV to target important warehouses, oil storage facilities, or other infrastructure.
original:
Khokhol began equipping an aircraft-type UAV with incendiary filling.

Not long ago, among the wreckage of a plane we shot down, we found the filling of a 9M22S rocket, which is usually used in the Grad combat vehicle.

The enemy is counting on the fact that a UAV with such a filling will fly to important warehouses, oil storage facilities, or other infrastructure.

It's time to go back.

description: HTS, a terrorist organization banned in the Russian Federation, has started recruiting former Syrian armed forces officers, excluding ideological and religious tests. This shift allows secular figures to join the group, similar to military experts from the former tsarist army of the Bolsheviks.
original:
Kirill SemenovAlbum, And this is what the military leadership of the terrorist organization banned in the Russian Federation now looks like “Hayat T...HTS (a terrorist organization banned in the Russian Federation) began to attract “military experts” into its ranks, that is, former officers of the Syrian armed forces who were previously not in affairs in emigration or as part of other groups.

This became possible when the ideological and religious component was excluded from the practice of recruiting militants into HTS. That is, they were no longer tested for knowledge of religious principles corresponding to the doctrines of Salafi jihadism widespread in HTS, and in fact, secular figures could also find themselves in the ranks of the group, that is, something similar to military experts from the former tsarist army of the Bolsheviks.
